data.name: PivotFieldList_And
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList dialogs. Example: between 10 and 20

data.name: PivotFieldList_AscendingBy
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList buttons and dialogs for ascending sorting. Example: Sort Ascending (A to Z) by

data.name: PivotFieldList_BaseField
data.comment: Used in the calculations dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It stays as a Label of the ListBox in which you are able to select the group description by which the calculation will be applied.

data.name: PivotFieldList_BaseItem
data.comment: Used in the calculations dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It stays as a Label of the ListBox in which you are able to select the group by which the calculation will be applied.

data.name: PivotFieldList_BeginsWith
data.comment: Used in the label filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It indicates that only groups that "begins with" string that is typed in the nearby TextBox will be displayed.

data.name: PivotFieldList_BottomItems
data.comment: Used in the Top 10 Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It indicates that the "last" items matching specified conditions, will be displayed.

data.name: PivotFieldList_By
data.comment: Used in Top 10 Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. In this dialog there are several options to choose how to apply the filter and this key provides value for a TextBlock, that will display by which aggregate the filter will be applied. Example: Top 10 items by Sum of Quantity

data.name: PivotFieldList_ChooseAggregateFunction
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList calculations dialog. It explains the function of the dialog.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ChooseFieldsToAddToReport
data.value: 选择字段进行数据透视:
data.comment: Used at the top part of RadPivotFieldList as a Header describing what to do with below fields.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ClearCalculations
data.comment: Used in drop-down menus of the buttons in RadPivotFieldList. It is shown only after calculation is applied and when you click it, the calculation is cleared.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ClearFilter
data.comment: Used in drop-down menus of the buttons in RadPivotFieldList. It is shown only after group filter is applied and when you click it, the filter is cleared.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ColumnLabels
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList as a header of the box, showing ColumnGroupDescriptions.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ConditionEquals
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList filter dialogs to mark that only items, that have equal value with the one entered in the TextBox nearby, will be shown.

data.name: PivotFieldList_Contains
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList filter dialogs to mark that only items, that contain value with the one entered in the TextBox nearby, will be shown.

data.name: PivotFieldList_DeferLayoutUpdate
data.comment: Used in the below part of RadPivotFieldList as a Checkbox by which you can enable defer of update and nearby button.

data.name: PivotFieldList_DescendingBy
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList buttons and dialogs for ascending sorting. Example: Sort Descending (A to Z) by

data.name: PivotFieldList_DifferenceFrom
data.comment: Used in the calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It marks that RadPivotGrid must show the values as a difference from a specific group selected in the other ListBox.

data.name: PivotFieldList_DoesNotBeginWith
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList filter dialogs to mark that only items, that does not begin with the value entered in the TextBox nearby, will be shown.

data.name: PivotFieldList_DoesNotContains
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList filter dialogs to mark that only items, that does not contain the value entered in the TextBox nearby, will be shown.

data.name: PivotFieldList_DoesNotEndWith
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList filter dialogs to mark that only items, that does not end with the value entered in the TextBox nearby, will be shown.

data.name: PivotFieldList_DoesNotEqual
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList filter dialogs to mark that only items, that are not equal with the value entered in the TextBox nearby, will be shown.

data.name: PivotFieldList_DragFieldsBetweenAreasBelow
data.value: 拖动字段到下面的区域:
data.comment: Used in the middle of RadPivotFieldList to explain how to move items between areas below.

data.name: PivotFieldList_EndsWith
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList filter dialogs to mark that only items, that are ends with the value entered in the TextBox nearby, will be shown.

data.name: PivotFieldList_FilterItemsP0
data.comment: Used in Report Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. This is the header of the window that is used for this dialog. The {0} is replaced by the name of the group description. Example: Filter Items (Product)

data.name: PivotFieldList_Format
data.comment: Used in Number Format dialog of RadPivotFieldList as a label to show that the nearby TextBox is used to format the values in the cells.

data.name: PivotFieldList_FormatCellsP0
data.comment: Used in Number Format dialog of RadPivotFieldList. This is the header of the window, that is used for this dialog. The {0} is replaced by the value of Pivot_AggregateP0ofP1. Example: Format Cells (Sum of Quantity)

data.name: PivotFieldList_GeneralFormat
data.comment: Used in Number Format dialog of RadPivotFieldList to mark the area where you are able to select string format for the cells.

data.name: PivotFieldList_IgnoreCase
data.comment: Used in Label Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. This is the text of the checkbox, that marks if the value entered in the above TextBox and group names in RadPivotGrid should ignore uppercase/lowercase differences.

data.name: PivotFieldList_Index
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList drop-down button of aggregate functions and calculations dialog. It marks index calculation.

data.name: PivotFieldList_IsBetween
data.comment: Used in Value filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is used in ComboBox inside the dialog, which selects how to use the value in the nearby numeric. When is between is selected, two numerics will be visible and the user can select range with them. Only groups which value is in the range will be visible.

data.name: PivotFieldList_IsGreaterThan
data.comment: Used in Value filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is used in ComboBox inside the dialog, which selects how to use the value in the nearby numeric. When is greater than is selected, only groups with value higher than entered, will be visible.

data.name: PivotFieldList_IsGreaterThanOrEqualTo
data.comment: Used in Value filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is used in ComboBox inside the dialog, which selects how to use the value in the nearby numeric. When is greater than or equal to is selected, only groups with value higher than entered or equal to it, will be visible.

data.name: PivotFieldList_IsLessThan
data.comment: Used in Value filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is used in ComboBox inside the dialog, which selects how to use the value in the nearby numeric. When is less than is selected, only groups with value less than entered, will be visible.

data.name: PivotFieldList_IsLessThanOrEqualTo
data.comment: Used in Value filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is used in ComboBox inside the dialog, which selects how to use the value in the nearby numeric. When is less than or equal to is selected, only groups with value less than entered or equal to it, will be visible.

data.name: PivotFieldList_IsNotBetween
data.comment: Used in Value filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is used in ComboBox inside the dialog, which selects how to use the value in the nearby numeric. When is not between is selected, two numerics will be visible and the user can select range with them. Only groups which value is not in the range will be visible.

data.name: PivotFieldList_LabelFilter
data.comment: Used in drop-down buttons of RadPivotFieldList. This value indicates that a Label filter will be applied. When you select this option in the drop-down menu, a new dialog will be opened.

data.name: PivotFieldList_LabelFilterP0
data.comment: Used in Label Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. This is the header of the window that is used for this dialog. The {0} is replaced by the name of the group description that will be filtered. Example: Label Filter (Product)

data.name: PivotFieldList_MoreAggregateOptions
data.comment: Used in drop-down buttons of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, a new dialog will be opened in which the user can select an aggregate function that will be used.

data.name: PivotFieldList_MoreCalculationOptions
data.comment: Used in drop-down buttons of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, a new dialog will be opened in which the user can select calculation function that will be used.

data.name: PivotFieldList_MoreSortingOptions
data.comment: Used in drop-down buttons of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, a new dialog will be opened in which the user can select how to sort RadPivotGrid.

data.name: PivotFieldList_NoCalculation
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that a calculation will not be applied.

data.name: PivotFieldList_Null
data.comment: Appears in the "Select Items" dialog for properties with null value.

data.name: PivotFieldList_NumberFormat
data.comment: Used in drop-down buttons of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, a new dialog will be opened in which the user can select the string format of the numbers shown in RadPivotGrid.

data.name: PivotFieldList_PercentDifferenceFrom
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that for each value in RadPivotGrid a difference from another group (selected in the next ListBox) will be calculated and the value will be shown as percent.

data.name: PivotFieldList_PercentOf
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that the values in RadPivotGrid will be shown as percent of another group (selected in the next ListBox).

data.name: PivotFieldList_PercentOfColumnTotal
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that the values in RadPivotGrid will be shown as percent of Colum Total.

data.name: PivotFieldList_PercentOfGrandTotal
data.comment: Used in drop-down buttons and calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that the values in RadPivotGrid will be shown as percent of the Grand Total.

data.name: PivotFieldList_PercentOfRowTotal
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that the values in RadPivotGrid will be shown as percent of Row Total.

data.name: PivotFieldList_PercentRunningTotalIn
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that the values in RadPivotGrid will be shown as percentages. The value shown in each cell is calculated as a sum of its own value and all of the values above. This sum is presented as a percent of the total (the value in the last cell of the column). So the last cell will have value 100% in all cases.

data.name: PivotFieldList_PleaseRefreshThePivot
data.comment: Used in the dialogs of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that in order to show the content of the dialog, a refresh of RadPivotGrid is necessary. This option may show only in cases when Defer Updates option is turned on.

data.name: PivotFieldList_RankLargestToSmallest
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that the values in RadPivotGrid will ranked and the largest one will be set to 1, the next to 2, etc..

data.name: PivotFieldList_RankSmallestToLargest
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that the values in RadPivotGrid will ranked and the smallest one will be set to 1, the next to 2, etc..

data.name: PivotFieldList_Refresh
data.comment: Used in a button inside the dialogs of RadPivotFieldList. The button indicates that a Refresh is needed in order to show the content of the dialog. This button may became visible only when Defer Updates is set to true.

data.name: PivotFieldList_RelativeToNext
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList. This item is visible in the second ListBox only for specific calculations (Difference from, % Difference From, etc.) and it marks that the values in RadPivotGrid will be shown as difference from the next group values.

data.name: PivotFieldList_RelativeToPrevious
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList. This item is visible in the second ListBox only for specific calculations (Difference from, % Difference From, etc.) and it marks that the values in RadPivotGrid will be shown as difference from the previous group values.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ReportFilter
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList as a header of the area where FilterGroupDescriptions are added.

data.name: PivotFieldList_RowLabels
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList as a header of the area where RowGroupDescriptions are added.

data.name: PivotFieldList_RunningTotalIn
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that the values in RadPivotGrid will be calculated in the following way: the value shown in each cell is calculated as a sum of its own value and all of the values above. So the last cell will have the value of the Total (sum of all values).

data.name: PivotFieldList_SelectAll
data.comment: Used in report filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, all items inside the dialog will be selected.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SelectItem
data.comment: Used in report filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList to mark the area where you can choose which groups to see in RadPivotGrid.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SelectItems
data.comment: Used in the drop-down button inside report filter box of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, a new dialog will open.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SetAverageAggregate
data.comment: Used in the drop-down button inside Values filter box of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, Average aggregate function will be applied to the values inside RadPivotGrid.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SetCountAggregate
data.comment: Used in the drop-down button inside Values filter box of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, Count aggregate function will be applied to the values inside RadPivotGrid.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SetIndexTotalFormat
data.comment: Used in the drop-down button inside Values filter box of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, Index calculation will be applied to the values inside RadPivotGrid.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SetPercentOfGrandTotalFormat
data.comment: Used in the drop-down button inside Values filter box of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, the values inside RadPivotGrid will be shown as percent of the Grand Total.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SetSumAggregate
data.comment: Used in the drop-down button inside Values filter box of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, Sum aggregate function will be applied to the values inside RadPivotGrid.

data.name: PivotFieldList_Show
data.comment: Used in the Top 10 Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It marks the area where users can select different options for the filter.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ShowEmptyGroups
data.comment: Used in the drop-down button inside Rows and Columns boxes of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, the empty groups will be shown in RadPivotGrid.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ShowItemsForWhich
data.comment: Used in Values filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It marks the area where users can select different options for the filter.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ShowItemsForWhichTheLabel
data.value: Show items for which the label
data.comment: Used in Label filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It marks the area where users can select different options for the filter.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ShowValuesAs
data.comment: Used in calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It marks the area where users can select which calculation function to apply.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ShowValuesAsP0
data.comment: Used as header of the calculation dialog of RadPivotFieldList. {0} is replaced by Pivot_AggregateP0ofP1 value. Example: Show Values As (Sum of Quantity)

data.name: PivotFieldList_SortAtoZ
data.comment: Used in drop-down menu of buttons inside Rows and Columns boxes of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, ascending order is applied.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SortOptions
data.comment: Used in sorting dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It marks the area where users can select what kind of sorting to apply.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SortP0
data.comment: Used as header of the sorting dialog in RadPivotFieldList. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: Sort (Product)

data.name: PivotFieldList_SortZtoA
data.comment: Used in drop-down menu of buttons inside Rows and Columns boxes of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, descending order is applied.

data.name: PivotFieldList_StringFormatDescription
data.value: 格式应设为可识别的格式. 格式化的结果将直接应用在求和、平均、最值等运算中.
data.comment: Used inside Number Format dialog of RadPivotFieldList. This is the description what can be achieved via the dialog.

data.name: PivotFieldList_SummarizeValuesBy
data.comment: Used in a dialog of RadPivotFieldList where the user can change the aggregate function. It marks the area where users can select which function to apply.

data.name: PivotFieldList_TheActionRequiresMoreRecentInformation
data.comment: Used in the dialogs of RadPivotFieldList to indicate that in order to show the content of the dialog, additional information is needed. It is combined with the value of PivotFieldList_PleaseRefreshThePivot to indicate that Refresh of RadPivotGrid is necessary. This option may show only in cases when Defer Updates option is turned on.

data.name: PivotFieldList_Top10FilterP0
data.comment: Used as header of the Top 10 filter dialog in RadPivotFieldList. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: Top10 Filter (Product)

data.name: PivotFieldList_Top10Items
data.comment: This value is used inside Top 10 Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is one of the options in the ComboBox, in which the user can select if the filter should be on Items, Percent or Sum. When this option is selected, user can show specific number of groups in RadPivotGrid - for example Top 10 groups by Sum of Quantity.

data.name: PivotFieldList_Top10Percent
data.comment: This value is used inside Top 10 Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is one of the options in the ComboBox, in which the user can select if the filter should be on Items, Percent or Sum. When this option is selected, user can show specific percent of groups in RadPivotGrid - for example Top 10 percent by Sum of Quantity.

data.name: PivotFieldList_Top10Sum
data.comment: This value is used inside Top 10 Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is one of the options in the ComboBox, in which the user can select if the filter should be on Items, Percent or Sum. When this option is selected, user can show groups, which summarize to a specific sum - for example Top 100 Sum by Sum of Quantity.

data.name: PivotFieldList_TopItems
data.comment: This value is used inside Top 10 Filter dialog of RadPivotFieldList. It is one of the options in the ComboBox, where the user can select if the Top or Bottom results of applied filter will be shown. When this option is selected, the Top results will be shown.

data.name: PivotFieldList_TopTenFilter
data.comment: Used in drop-down menu of buttons inside Rows and Columns boxes of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, a new dialog will be opened, where the user can apply Top 10 filter.

data.name: PivotFieldList_Update
data.comment: Used as a content of a button inside RadPivotFieldList. When the button is clicked, RadPivotGrid is refreshed. The button is enabled only when Defer Updates is set to true.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ValueFilter
data.comment: Used in drop-down menu of buttons inside Rows and Columns boxes of RadPivotFieldList. When this option is selected, a new dialog will be opened, where the user can apply Value filter.

data.name: PivotFieldList_ValueFilterP0
data.comment: Used as a header of the Value Filter dialog of RadPivotGrid. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: Value Filter (Product)

data.name: PivotFieldList_ValueSummarizationP0
data.comment: Used as a header of the aggregate description dialog of RadPivotGrid. {0} is replaced by Pivot_AggregateP0ofP1 value. Example: Value Summarization (Sum of Quantity)

data.name: PivotFiledList_Values
data.comment: Used in RadPivotFieldList. This is the header of the box in which are the aggregate descriptions.

data.name: Pivot_AggregateAverage
data.comment: Average aggregate function. Example: Average of Quantity

data.name: Pivot_AggregateCount
data.comment: Count aggregate function. Example: Count of Products

data.name: Pivot_AggregateMax
data.comment: Max aggregate function. Example: Max of Net

data.name: Pivot_AggregateMin
data.comment: Min aggregate function. Example: Min of Net

data.name: Pivot_AggregateP0ofP1
data.comment: When you apply aggregate function for a specific property, RadPivotGrid and RadPivotFieldList show similar string: Sum of Quantity. This key will help you to localize such strings and particularly the "of" part. In the common scenario you should have {0} to show the aggregate function, your string that will replace the "of" part and {1} for property name.

data.name: Pivot_AggregateProduct
data.comment: Product aggregate function. Example: Product of Quantity

data.name: Pivot_AggregateStdDev
data.comment: Sample Standard Deviation aggregate function. Example: StdDev of Net

data.name: Pivot_AggregateStdDevP
data.comment: Population Standard Deviation aggregate function. Example: StdDevP of Net

data.name: Pivot_AggregateSum
data.comment: Sum aggregate function. Example: Sum of Net

data.name: Pivot_AggregateVar
data.comment: Simple Variance aggregate function. Example: Var of Net

data.name: Pivot_AggregateVarP
data.comment: Population Variance aggregate function. Example: VarP of Net

data.name: Pivot_Column
data.comment: Used in tooltip to mark the Column in which is the current value.

data.name: Pivot_DayGroup
data.comment: Used as a DisplayName of the Day Step of a Field with DateTime dataType. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: ShippingDate-Day

data.name: Pivot_Error
data.comment: Used in RadPivotGrid to mark that the value in the cell is not correct. You may see this string when the property which you are trying to aggregate is not a number, when there is division with 0, etc.

data.name: Pivot_GrandTotal
data.comment: Used in RadPivotGrid as the header of the row/column showing the Grand Totals of the aggregation.

data.name: Pivot_GroupP0AggregateP1
data.comment: Used in RadPivotGrid as header of the rows/columns, which is showing SubTotal when there are more than one aggregate description. {0} parameter is replaced by items name, while {1} parameter is replaced by Pivot_AggregateP0ofP1 value. Example: For the {0}='Copy Holder' group, the aggregated {1}='Sum of Quantity' it will format the aggregate group name as Copy Holder Sum of Quantity

data.name: Pivot_HourGroup
data.comment: Used as a DisplayName of the Hour Step of a Field with DateTime dataType. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: ShippingDate-Hour

data.name: Pivot_MinuteGroup
data.comment: Used as a DisplayName of the Minute Step of a Field with DateTime dataType. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: ShippingDate-Minute

data.name: Pivot_MonthGroup
data.comment: Used as a DisplayName of the Month Step of a Field with DateTime dataType. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: ShippingDate-Month

data.name: Pivot_P0Total
data.comment: Used in RadPivotGrid as header of the row/column, which is showing SubTotals. The {0} parameter is replaced by group name. Example: Newspaper Total

data.name: Pivot_QuarterGroup
data.comment: Used as a DisplayName of the Quarter Step of a Field with DateTime dataType. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: ShippingDate-Quarter

data.name: Pivot_Row
data.comment: Used in tooltip to mark the Row in which is the current value.

data.name: Pivot_SecondGroup
data.comment: Used as a DisplayName of the Second Step of a Field with DateTime dataType. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: ShippingDate-Second

data.name: Pivot_TotalP0
data.comment: Used in RadPivotGrid as header of the row/column, which is showing the Totals for each of the aggregate description when there are more than one. If AggregatesPosition property of RadPivotGrid is set to "Rows", than the last rows in RadPivotGrid will show the "Totals" for each of the aggregate descriptions. The headers of these last rows can be modified with this key. {0} is replaced by Pivot_AggregateP0ofP1 value. Example: Total Sum of Quantity

data.name: Pivot_Value
data.comment: Used in tooltip to mark the Value of the current cell.

data.name: Pivot_Values
data.comment: Used in the tooltip, when there are more than one aggregate descriptions, to describe the special "Values" group that is created (you can see it in rows/columns in RadPivotFieldList).

data.name: Pivot_WeekGroup
data.comment: Used as a DisplayName of the Week Step of a Field with DateTime dataType. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: ShippingDate-Week

data.name: Pivot_YearGroup
data.comment: Used as a DisplayName of the Year Step of a Field with DateTime dataType. {0} is replaced by the property name that is used. Example: ShippingDate-Year
